今日はみんなで公園に遊びに行きました。少し引っ込み思案
なのか、あまり自分から遊びの輪の中に入ろうとしないみたいです。先生は、ちょっとだけそこが心配です。

今日はお友達と小さなケンカをしてしまいました。
どうやらお友達に嘘をついてしまったようです。
お家で少しお話をしてみてくださいね。

今日は「将来の夢」についてお話をしたのですが……
斜に構えているというか、少し大人を馬鹿にするところが
ありますね。お家でよくお話をしてください。

こんな子供の頃から中二病なんて救いようがなくない？
可愛げがないんだよね。イラッとする。こんな子、高学年に
なったら虐めにあって引きこもりコースじゃない？
Beauty > Ugly
Beauty - Ugly = More beauty?\nBeauty + Ugly = Peculiarly beautiful?
Beauty x Ugly = Worthless?\nBeauty ÷ Ugly = Lovable?
Equations for the beautiful, known only to the beautiful, that equate flawless beauty.\n\nYou're only ugly because you believe that.

This is the tale of a scorpion, that invited only the greatest of passions. Long long ago in a faraway place, a beautiful blue-eyed queen lived in happiness. However, one day her kingdom was crushed by an enemy nation and she lost everything.
Consumed by a burning hatred, she contrived to enter the harem of the enemy conqueror. With the help of her lady in waiting and the venom of a scorpion, she began to ascend through the harem.

Having acquired the love of the king, she set her aim higher still, seeking to gain control of the nation to move as she willed. The wives who tried to stop her fell victim to the scorpion's venom. They'd tried to kill her, after all. It was only fair.

Though her own death seemed a surety more than once, she struggled forward, seeking her revenge. For the lady in waiting, the entire affair was a stirring drama of clashing love and hatred that served excellently to relieve her intense boredom. To this day, she has never been bored since. How lovely.

この世のどこかに『其れ』は潜む。
手に入れし者は『其れ』に嘘偽りのない愛を捧げよ。
しからば、如何なる願いも叶えてくれるであろう。

小国の若き王は『其れ』を手に入れし時分、うねり輝く姿を
美しいと賛辞した。『其れ』は喜びに震え、王の願いを叶え
る事を承諾すると、小国はみるみる豊かな大国へと変化した。

王は『其れ』を富の象徴として手厚く奉り、『其れ』も
惜しみなく恩恵をもたらした。国には安寧の日々が続き、
安堵した王は美しい妃を娶ることとなった。

婚儀の折、王が「全ての愛を我が妃に捧げる」と宣誓すると、
空に暗雲が立ち込め、雷は王を貫き、国をも打ち砕いた。
富の象徴の『其れ』は、いつの間にか姿を消していたという。

The bear, who lived always with slothful and indolent ways, frowned in annoyance before speaking.\n"Ugh that guy...! Just because he's sooo rich, he thinks...I mean, just because he's got a little more money than the rest of us, he...UGH, he thinks he's sooo hot. God's gift to women...as if! He's delusional!"

"And kids. Like, I guess they're fine if they stay quiet, but THAT brat? Ugh, no. Can't even be bothered to pay attention to other people, because god forbid something get in the way of a nap! And it's like...oh, I guess you're too good to talk to a bear like me, huh?"

"And that other woman who's been hanging around here recently, always going on about justice or whatnot, it's obvious she thinks I'm basically the scum of society. Well, I suppose I should take that as a compliment, considering our line of work, right? Hm? What was that? You think I'm an idiot? Well..."

"Yeah, they were getting way to full of themselves so I basically kicked the shit out of them. It wasn't even a fight! Like beating up a bunch of toddlers. ...So don't think any of the rest of you can get away with mocking me, either! Seriously, I'll...you just watch yourselves, alright? Anyway, see ya."

The person I've been observing is an old man. He wanted to be struck with desire again, for a young woman. I helped him out. I thought she would be happy to know the passion she inspired, but it seems I was wrong in that assumption, as the young lady in question quite literally ran screaming.

The person I've been observing is a young girl. She wanted to do something to help her hard working mother find a new husband. I helped them out, filling she and her prospective beau with a towering, consuming desire for one another. They ran away together, abandoning the girl, who later died of hunger. A regrettable miscalculation.

In the course of using my powers, I:ve left countless people ruined by their lovers. I've raised countless people to be heights of passion, as well, to cherish their lovers, and treat them like royalty. Truly, there is no end to the desire that can dwell in a human heart, nor any end to the myriad different ways such stories reach their conclusions.

Who shall I observe next? Just a brush of my power can cast countless tragedies in the world, and who will drown in that sea of sorrows? What expressions will they wear as they slip beneath it's surface? That, at least, is well worth observing.

アラジンは貧しい青年でした。時には他人から糧を盗み、
母と自分のお腹を満たす日々。それでも真面目に働こうとは
せず、「何とかなるさ」と呑気に暮らしていました。

そんなアラジンの前に、叔父と騙る魔法使いが現れます。
魔法使いはアラジンに宝探しの手伝いを頼みました。
人の良いアラジンは疑う事なく協力します。
そうして宝探しに向かった洞窟で、アラジンは『願いを叶える魔法のランプ』を手に入れました。このランプをどうするかと悩む事で、アラジンは自然と知識を身につけ財を成します。
悪い魔法使いの妨害を跳ねのけ、アラジンは愛をもって国の姫と結ばれました。けれど……急激に裕福となった「成金」である彼は、結局金でしか己の存在意義を示せなかったのです……

The little village was terrified of wolves. Day after day, the pack preyed on their livestock, and occasionally a small child would fall victim to their depredations.\n\nThen, one day, the wolves' attacks just...stopped.

The villagers were mystified, and it was decided that some few would brave the light snowfall to venture into the wolves' domain in the forest and see what may be seen. There they found countless numbers of corpses, wolves and sheep alike, lying crumpled and bloody on the ground.

Realizing that the attacks had ceased because the wolves were all dead, the villagers leapt for joy, embracing each other in sheer relief. Loathe to waste such a bounty, they harvested meat from the sheep and pelts from the wolves.

They knew not the cause of the slaughter, nor did they care to know, as they rummaged through the unexpected bounty for anything useful. And the wolves, now become spirits in their erstwhile domain, watched as the end they had called upon themselves with a heartrending determination was sullied by human hands.

This is a story of the raven who wallowed in greed. Long long ago, there was a woman who clung fiercely to her youth and beauty in adorning herself. To show others that she was beautiful was everything to her, and she had a great love of gemstones.

However, it so happened that there came a time when her jewels began to diminish, one by one. She was baffled, for though her doors were locked, the signs told her someone had managed to enter her home nonetheless. She grew more and more fearful and paranoid, plagued by theft but unable to consult the police.

For among her trove of jewels, there were some that had been liberated from their former owners by violent and even deadly means. She saw their faces, wherever she turned, always. The faces of all those she'd killed for their beautiful jewels. Always, always, always, always, always, always, always, always...

Driven in terror and guild, the woman fled to the police and confessed her crimes. She was immediately arrested. When the police investigated her abandoned house, they found a single raven lying dead, but none there had the ability to determine the cause or the reason for this grim omen. The end.
Since ancient times, nothing has been more revered than the bond between blood relatives.\nThe Three Little Pigs born here were no exception, and were well known in the neighborhood.
"We'll share all our joy and happiness, sorrows and anger."\n"We'll be together in both life and death."\n"We'll share everything."

When the trio left their parents to build their own homes, the sisters made a vow to each other: "No matter where we live, we'll always be together."\nAnd their vow remained unbroken even when attacked by the big bad wolf.

The wolf, having eaten the eldest two sisters, was then served justice when the youngest piggie boiled him inside a pot. Afterwards, she too entered the pot where both her juices and the juices of her sisters inside the wolf stirred together, thus fulfilling the sisters' vow.
I grew up following your words, Mama. I met my prince and did exactly what you had taught me. I've continued to live a pure, righteous, obedient, and virtuous life.

Men are so kind to me and are pleased when we get along together. Because of that, they always come back asking for more. However, other women seem to have their own opinion, and often I'm subjugated to their verbal abuse.
I wish I could befriend women as easily as I can with men. Why can't we get along? Why do they envy me? Why do they get mad and despise me for being me? I haven't done anything wrong!

I want to get along with everyone, everyone can die, die.\nI want to with men! Women can die! Men can die! I want to with women!\nThis is...a lot to clean up. I can't tell who's male or female anymore.

How many Alices had she killed, now? She didn't know. In truth, she'd given up on counting long ago. The first time, she hadn't even meant to do it, had only defended herself against an Alice who'd suddenly attacked.

The Alices she'd killed...they'd looked at her with such anguish, as they died. Perhaps, if they'd been able to speak at the end, they would have had something to tell her, some final wish. She would never know, now.

The first time, as she'd watched Alice die, she'd wondered over and over, why it had come to this, whether it truly had to be this way...Now, though...through all the Alices she's killed and the weary inevitability of the Alices she has yet to kill, she doesn't feel anything but exhaustion.

After all, wasn't this her fate? If so, what point thinking about any of it? It would be a supreme act of arrogance, to even think she had a say. So she stopped thinking, and merely offered up her sins for heaven to judge in its time. Today, Alice would kill another Alice. Today, she would tell herself, as she did, that this was fated. Inevitable.

The Little Mermaid is playing her flute,
Aladdin is talking nonsense, and Dorothy is doing...something.
Sis is making food, and I'm sitting here with my blanket.

Sis gave me the blanket and it's smooth and soft super nice, so I love it a lot. I can't sleep when I don't have it,
so I wanna keep it forever.

Sis said she was just going to wash it,
but I don't wanna let her take it.
Sis told me she'd hold me until it was done washing, and picked me up.

My blanket makes me feel safe, but Sis holding me
makes me feel even safer. That's why I said
she could wash my blanket if she kept holding me.

I'm a total genius, so there's nothing I can't understand!
I'm nothing like clumsy Alice, crybaby Little Mermaid,\nand stuck-up Aladdin!

I'm a genius, so I don't need Sis to help me with dinner,
and I can even take a bath by myself.
I'm gonna prove it!

...I couldn't have predicted slipping in the bath like that.
Sis being mad at me was more predictable.
She said I could have drowned.
...I didn't mean to make her worry.

I'm a genius, so I can definitely analyze this situation,
and create even more opportunities for Alice, the Little Mermaid,
Aladdin, Sis and me to live together happily!

The Little Mermaid was really sad, so she cried.
She got even sadder and cried even more.
Sis asked her why she was sad, but she didn't know.
She was just sad.

She cried for so long, she got hungry and so she cried some more.
Sis gave her some food, but she didn't have any appetite and only cried.
Then she spilled her milk, and cried over that too.

She had a scary nightmare and woke up crying.
Sis picked her up an asked what was wrong,
and her arms were so warm that she cried harder.

She played with Alice and Dorothy and Aladdin and Sis,
and there wasn't anything sad at all, she was having so much fun.
Even so, she couldn't stop crying. Why?

Raising kids is hard, especially for a single mom like Sis.
That's why I think the system should be putting some work
into social innovation to help with things.

By proactively participating with a consortium on childrearing,
and putting more resources into childcare,
 working mothers will have what they need to advance the, um, social, um...

Sis smiled and complimented me for my vocabulary!
Ow! What was that for, Dorothy?
...And the way the Little Mermaid is staring at me while she cries is really scary.

Alice explained things. She said that Sis loves all of us. Oh.
So Dorothy and the Little Mermaid must be jealous of me, right?
I asked Alice if she was jealous too but she just wrapped herself up in her blanket.

In the beginning, the Divine brought blessings to a desolate land. The heart of the blessing were gemstones that contained all the light of the Divine, stones such that could never be polished into a shape by mortal hands.

The Divine looked upon the gems and the light that they contained, and saw that it was good. Mortals, thinking the stones to be vessels of the Divine, took to gathering them and lavishing them with reverence. Only afterwards, did they become known as jewels.

At length, the Divine departed and returned to the heavens, leaving mortals alone upon the earth. As time passed, the gemstones became but symbols of wealth for the mortals who possessed them. Curiously, people seemed more desperate to own them now, than when they had been symbols of divinity. They stole to get them. They killed to get them. They went to war.

As the land fell once more into desolation, buried under rivers of blood, the people vanished from the earth and only the jewels remained. The Divine gazed upon the lonely gems, reflecting that there were few sweeter things in this world than a powerful greed, and laughing so hard that ebon feathers shook loose and began fluttering to the ground.

A: Can't virtual idols can take on many different forms?
If so, I want to be the kind the princes like.
I want to be men's ideal woman!
Q: Well, at least this girl's consistent.
A: And there's virtual men idols. How wonderful. I'd love to play a game with them!\nQ: But you know, some of those man idols are just females in disguise...\nA: What...?

A: I only want to play games with REAL male virtual idols!
Q: All she did was emphasize the same thing.
A: Then after we exchange messages, we'll have a sexy night out and...
Q: Stop right there! That's it for today!
Q: What would you do if you became a virtual idol?\nA: Sleep.\nQ: Give us something more than that! Besides, you're always sleeping!
A: That's because I don't know anything else but sleep.\nQ: Well, since it's virtual, you can create a new appearance for yourself.\nA: Then, I'll be a cat and stream myself sleeping.
Q: Are those kind of streams in demand...? Let's give  it a try.\nA: Oookay... Zzzz... Meow...\nQ: Woah! We just got an influx of viewers!

A: Mhn... Alice as a guy... That's weird...zzzz\nQ: "It's adorable when she sleep-talks." "I can watch this all day!" "Kitty cat!"\nThe comments are quite positive. I think the relation between Sleeping Beauty and a happily napping cat makes her the winner...
目の前の女がちっとも悲しくなさそうに泣いている。曰く「ただの舞台装置で可哀想」ということらしい。蠍のような精霊は首を傾げる。それのどこが悪いのだろう？
傍観し続けることは素晴らしい。蠍だった頃に観察していた後宮の女は最高だった。彼女は蠍の毒である媚薬と、女官長の立場を利用し数多の人間を淫蕩と愛欲に突き落としてくれた。
この泣いている女だってそうだ。可哀相だと口にしながら、早速精霊の力を利用して悲劇を生み出し続けてくれている。精霊はそれを最高の特等席で眺めていられるのだ。
精霊は傍観者である。ただの舞台装置で構わない。なぜなら力を手にし、欲を孕めば、勝手に堕ちてゆくのが「人間」なのだ。これほど便利な物語自動製造機はあるまい。

A: Oh, that's right. I'm a real idol born in Miyazaki...! Not virtual at all...!\nQ: Of course. Now then, please answer the question.\nA: So, when I become a virtual idol...? Hm...

A: I want to show the awesomeness of Miyazaki to everyone on the other side of the screen!
Q: Virtual or no, you pushing Miyazaki won't ever change.
A: Oh, and I want to do a game collaboration!
Q: Indeed, your dream will surely come true...

A: And I'll be like a game guide character in it!
Q: Huh? In that case, wouldn't that make you the game guide from the start?
A: Oh... How would that work then...?
Q: Ah, don't come near me with that blunt instrument—urgh! *rattle*

Sleeping whenever I feel tired, waking whenever I like. This is the best!\n\nAnd what's the point of working yourself to death anyway? Wouldn't your parents be sad? A relaxed life is the best thing for me and for them!

In this day and age, who could ever need to go out and toil and sweat to get by? I can just cool my heels around the house, savoring the delicious flavor of a salmon dinner someone else caught. I mean, is there any taste sweeter than a delicious meal you didn't have to lift a finger for? I'm winning at life!

Look, I could work if I wanted to! If have to, I can do it! Totally. This isn't even my full power, okay? It's just that today is my day to recharge. I really need to take it easy. Self care. You get it, right?\n\nTomorrow. Tomorrow is the day I'll get to work. Tomorrow, I'll...

Ahh...I think I overslept, even more than usual...All my plans are ruined now, half the day is gone!\n\nWell, there goes my motivation. There's no point in doing anything now...I guess I'll just tackle things tomorrow. Right. Well, 'night, then...

We tried to kill each other on a regular basis when they were adults, but I'm supposed to take care of them now that they're kids?
It's a crazy thing to ask, but... eh. Whatever, I guess.
I get to decide how to raise them, and how I'll betray them, in the end.

Ugh! I never thought Alice could be so clumsy!
How did she manage to wrap her blanket around her neck in the space of a nap!
How does tossing and turning even cause that? Does she WANT to die?

The Little Mermaid cries so much it makes me sick, and Dorothy breaks all her toys.
Aladdin puts everything he can get his hands on into his mouth.
This is at least ten times more exhausting than life with my awful stepsisters. Are they trying to kill me?

Just... go back to normal! It can't happen soon enough.
Hurry up and get grown so I can look back on all the bottles and diapers and baths someday and laugh about it...
I was finally forced to raise the white flag and give into the uncontrollable tears of my young daughter. When I asked what had happened, she only kept slurring the same unintelligible words.

It took a lot of patience, but eventually she said she saw of some sort of monster, or at least a bird with huge wings. At any rate, what I could get from her was that some unknown creature had stolen my daughter's necklace.

My daughter considered the necklace as a memento of my late mother. But for me, it was that of my wife. Despite this, if it was some monster that took it from her, she should be glad it spared her life. When I expressed this to her, however, she shook her head crying louder.

"But it wasn't enough," my daughter sniffled, pointing her trembling finger upwards. My eyes followed her finger up. It was then I understood what she meant. Indeed, it wasn't enough. Right above me a huge beak had spread out, ready to swallow me whole.
心理テストです。貴方は夜の森を歩いています。ゆっくりと進むと前から何かが近づいてきました。それは「犬」「梟」「蛇」「蠍」のうちのどれですか？
結婚する際に一番大切にしているものがわかるテストでした。犬は思いやり、梟は知識や教養、蛇は子孫繁栄、蠍は体の相性、悦楽です。貴方は犬ですか、お優しい。私？私は内緒です。
……あら、どうしました？体がうまく動かないんですね。先程お渡しした飲み物に少し混ぜ物をさせていただいたんです。でも安心してください、命に別状はありませんから。
ただ私と、ゆっくりと気持ちよくなっていただければ……。私が選んだ答え、もうお分かりでしょう？ふふ……私、蠍なんですよ。

Princess Kaguya pointed a finger at the plate to her right, a smile of utter enchantment curling her lips. "This plate looks like it's got several pieces of meat on it and...oh, just look at the juices...it all looks so delicious. Hehe..."

Next she turned and pointed to the plate to her left, letting out a little sigh as she looked. "This one's a roast, it looks so charming, how they've got it tied up with string all neat and tidy...It's been cooked through nice and evenly, practically shouting that it's ready to eat, don't you think?"

"I just can't choose! I want to eat all of it...but, I suppose if I really had a choice, instead of eating one of these lovely platters, I'd love to find someone stronger than me and let them..." She turned as she was speaking, but the spirit had vanished.

She'd been drawn here by that sprit's strength, and now, left to drown in her own hunger, Princess Kaguya did not stop to consider the provenance of the meat that sat on those plates. She did not even stop to consider if that might matter. She simply ate her filled, smiling with graceful satisfaction as she declared it to have been delicious, indeed.

I visited a strange country for my apprenticeship. On top of the tens of thousands of rules, the people lived their lives under a mask. But in that country there was a boy who saved me from living alone.

By law I was prohibited to speak, but he made friends with me regardless. And he...didn't flinch when seeing the burn marks on my face. To me he was a prince. Although, it's ironic now he's the king of that country...

I'll never forget the day he confessed his feelings for me. It's a memory I'll forever treasure. For someone who spoke so confidently, that day he appeared a bit timid. I nodded in response, but his mask prevented me from seeing his reaction.

It is now the night before our wedding. If I am allowed to speak tomorrow, I already know the first words I'll say to him. Recalling the meaning of those words, he exhaled sleeping soundly besides me.

Catching up on sleep on your days off is just myth. The ideal amount of sleep averages daily by— (Continuation is omitted)

Sleeping Beauty jumped with joy the following day.\nIt is to be regretted that the thorns surrounding her bed still remain, as such the 'peace of mind' I originally desired was not achieved. Something tells me she'd be upset if I removed them...

――ハー、またデスか……
スノウホワイト（以下スノウ）：いきなりため息とは失礼だな。私が何をしたというんだ。

――イヤだって三連覇ナンて面白みノ欠片モありませんヨ？
スノウ：みなが私を支えてくれた結果、それだけだ。それに、人気投票をやって欲しいなんて、頼んだ覚えもないしな。

――正直、他のキャラなんてイラない。なんて思ッテません？
スノウ：失礼なことを言うな！全ての人間にはそれぞれ生まれてきた意味がある。誰一人として蔑ろにされるべきではない！

――ホゥ。それはくるみ割り人形デモ同じなんでしょウカ？
スノウ：そ、それはその、あれだ。そもそも人間なのかということから議論すべきで……。なぁ、この話はもう止めないか？

――人形たち！一体なんですかこの衣装は！！
ギシン＆アンキ：ヒィ、いきなり怒鳴ラナいでクダさい！み、見たママのブービー賞デス、受賞おめでとうございます……

――私にこんなものを渡してどういうつもりですか！
ギシン：イヤアノ、例の彼女ガ三連覇しちゃって………！！
アンキ：正直我々も想定内だったというか何トいいマスか！

ギシン：デモ運営ガ急遽ブービー賞を決めタイって言ッテ！
アンキ：時間もナイし彼女ノ衣装のハギレで作るシカなくて！
ギシン＆アンキ：不本意だったんデス！許シテください！！
――なんて素晴らしい生地なんだ！サテンシルクでしょうか。裏地の仕上げも完璧！特にこの襟元、右から７番目のこの針の通し方！なんて美しい。あぁそれにこの縫い方は恐ら（以下略

兄様と過ごした３年……ふふ……甘くてとろけるような
思い出や、苦くて歯が折れるような思い出がありました
けど……兄様と過ごした日々は全て宝物です。

兄様、どうかずっと私の傍にいて下さいね。
兄様、どうかずっと私とお喋りして下さいね。
兄様、どうかずっと私を可愛がって下さいね。

……ほら、兄様の声が聞こえる。
「大丈夫だよ、グレーテル。誰よりも愛しているよ」って。
兄様、私もです。誰よりも何よりも兄様が一番です。

だから兄様、私の前から消えないで。
私から視線を外さないで。その手を、指を、離さないで。
ねえ、画面の向こうの兄様……
迷子の子豚が一匹。姉二匹とはぐれ彷徨い、空腹に座り込む三女の前に、獅子に似た精霊が現れた。それは力を与えてくれた。食べるためにどんなものでも殺せる、素晴らしい力だった。
逃げ出した子豚が一匹。妹二匹を置いて、森の中を彷徨うのは長女の子豚。長女の助けを乞う声に、神聖な力が応えた。それは壊れてしまった三女を殺せる、素晴らしい力だった。
取り残された子豚が一匹。世界をも食べ尽くす三女と、三女を殺そうとしている長女の殺し合いを眺めながら、次女は思い出していた。当たり前に続くと信じていた、ささやかな願いを。
どこにも行けない化け物が一匹。食べ尽くされて食べるものが何もない場所で、化け物は汚い笑い声をあげながら、自分の腕を食べた。

この３年間、様々な事があったと思う。
一番に思い出されるのは、やはり最初の騒動だろうか。
まさかライブラリに接続できないとはな……

あの悪夢を乗り越えて私達に会いに来てくれたこと、
心から感謝している。ライブラリの住人を代表して
礼を言わせてほしい。本当に……ありがとう。

私の正義はとても窮屈で、頑固で、自分勝手で……
見ているあなた方を不快にさせているかもしれない。
それでも、私はこの生き方を変える事はできない。

私は、己の正義を貫いて主の復活を成し遂げてみせる。
その姿を見せることが、あなた方への感謝の証になる……
と思うのは、独善的だろうか？

この３年は悪夢のようでしたわ。
だって、強い殿方に出会えなかったんですもの。
誰も、私が願うようにこの体を虐めてはくれなかった……

もしかして、私、魅力がないのでしょうか。
だから強い殿方が寄ってこないのでしょうか。
そう――きっとそうですわ。何もかも私がいけないのです！

もっと私に魅力があれば、皆さんに苛んでいただけたのに。
服を破って、縛って、打って、蹴って、貫いて……ああ……
もっともっと、あられもなくお仕置きして貰えたのに！

私、心を入れ替えました。これからは皆さんが「強くなって
この卑しい女を虐めたい」と思うような女になります。
それが、３年も私を見ていてくれた皆さんへの恩返しですわ。
This is scary... Where the heck am I?\nNo light. No wind. No sound. Nothing.\nBut most importantly, my brother's missing...
How long have I been in here?\nIt was then I suddenly felt I wasn't alone.\nWhatever this presence was, it felt just like me. Sad and anxious.
I gently wiped away all the fear, anxiety, and suffering.\nAnd caressed ever so softly...\nIn doing so, it somehow put me at ease.
I thought I heard a voice calling out to me.\nI can't... I can't be in this place anymore.\nI'm sorry, brother... I love you.

この世は二つに分けられる。美しいか醜いか。
美しいものは残しましょう。醜いものは消しましょう。
――では、外見は美しいのに内面が醜いものはどうするか？

答えは簡単。
美しい外ノ皮を剥ぎ取って、醜い中ノ魂は消しましょう。
――デハ、外見は醜いノに内面が美しいもノはどうするか？

答えハ簡単。
美しイ内面ニ、美しイ外ノ皮ヲ被せればイイ。
私モそうヤッテ美しくナッタのダカラ。

ソレナノニ――外ノ皮ガ爛レテグジュグジュト音ガスル。
痛イ痛イ汚イ臭イ。膿ンデ腐ッテ蛆ガ這ウ。
アアソウカ、私ハ中身ガ　美シク　ナカッタ　　ノダ。
３周年じゃと？ふざけるな！ワガハイが登場してから２年と４ヶ月しか経っておらんぞ？祝うならば「くるみ割り人形登場から２年４か月（１日足らず）祝い」とするべき……

２周年記念の時は、日数に拘っていなかった？知るか！
ワガハイが１年前の事を覚えていられるとでも？か弱き老人に対する期待値が高過ぎる。全くもって嘆かわしい……

良いか？若者は常に老人を敬い、称え、譲り、もてなすべきである。老人は知恵の蔵。経験の塊。この世の宝であるぞ？
ちなみに、老人と書いてワガハイと読むべき……
まあお主達若者も、この３年、ライブラリで色々な悪夢を見たであろう。それに対しては報いの言葉をかけてやっても良い。……頑張ったな。ところで、メシはまだかのう？

The God of Fortitude says, "In this enigmatic and mysterious world, I have the power to alter the size of my body. It is a power that fits our deeds as an incarnation of God. But by what means was this accomplished?
When the girl takes that power as her own, it becomes something so devastating that it can easily crush any foe. A power that can even face that atrocious queen head on.
However, that is but the measure of men. As such, even that strength falls short of our God. Compared to God, she is merely a small child unable to transcend mankind and defy God.

Despite knowing the truth, she stands determined to resurrect her author—even if it means death. Although her spirit may be reckless, her thoughts are magnificent and admirable. Fight to the fullest and die without regret."

少女は恋をした。
水の中で生きる少女と、陸の上で生きる人間の物語。
それは種別の壁を越えた少女の純粋な恋物語。

少女は種族を捨てた。
宝石のような声を犠牲に、剣山のような脚を得た。
そうまでしてでも王子に会いたいと願った。

少女は気付いた。
王子には意中の人がいること。自分とは結ばれないこと。
自分が邪魔なこと。死ぬことが王子の幸せになること。

少女は愚かだった。
恋敵の女がいるなら殺す、それが叶わぬなら王子を殺す。
それこそが本当に純粋な恋物語。
When the town of Hamelin was overrun by rats, a flutist appeared and rid them from the streets. But when the townspeople went back on their promise to pay him, he became very angry.

As retribution, the man played an enchanting melody on his flute and lured the town's children from their homes, never to return again. Not because he had kidnapped them, rather they chose to stay on their own.

The children liked the man. He was kind and took good care of them. He praised them for being the good little boys and girls they were. But the man had a dream—a dream the children were eager to grant.

As soon as the children grown into gorgeous and lovely human beings, he picked apart their best pieces to create the perfect "aesthetic" figure. Both the man's and the children's dreams had be realized...

□th of ●●●●\nFunding for the lab is running low, so I've decided to get a new sponsor. I suppose it goes without saying who I've tapped for the role. The nouveau riche are truly a font of blessings when it comes to research.

×rd of ●●●●\nMy pride as a scientist won't allow me to receive financing without providing any kind of results in return, so I've decided to develop a new weapon for Aladdin, although exactly what kind of weapon, I haven't settled on yet...

〇th of ●●●●\nI've asked Alice for advice communicating, and she says that gifting someone something that's meaningful to you is a good way to make sure they understand how you feel. To wit, I've had the most amazing idea! Such is the power of bondage. I've always appreciated the benefits of being able to freely restrain my subjects.

▲th of △△△△\nFollowing the example of my dear friend, who was formerly human but had his every part gradually exchanged for tin replacements until he'd lost his heart...I've created a tin servitor for Aladdin! I'm certain he'll find it useful.

夏休み。兄様と二人で新しい兄様を捕りにいく。
新しい兄様は強そうだけど兄様も相変わらず可愛い。

８月１０日
あの女は嫌い。兄様に色目を使うだけではなく、私にも気持ち悪い目を向ける。あの女に関わるのはやめましょう、兄様。

８月２７日
闘技場に兄様の死骸が増えていく。違う。あれは兄様じゃない。ただの虫。でも兄様。兄様？あれ？兄様って……

今日も森へ虫取りに。でもカブトムシは捕まえられず、
何故か毒虫ばかり。「どうして君達ばかりなの？」と聞いても答えてはくれない。コオロギとは話ができたんだけどな。

８月１０日
「たまにはみんなで遊びましょう。せっかくの夏休みだし」
とラプンツェルさんが誘ってきた。するとグレーテルさんが「やめた方がいい」と、珍しく僕に話しかけてきた！

８月２３日
ラプンツェルさんはいつも男の人を連れている。「これは虫です」と言い張っているけど……グレーテルさんが彼女を避ける理由が何となく判ってきた気がする。女の人って怖い。

８月５４１７日
ぼくはきょうもむしをつかまえてとうぎじょうでたたかわせる。どうしてこんなことをするのかわからないけど、そう指示があったから。指示があるのはうれしいなあはははは。

８月５日
みんなと過ごす夏休み。
宿題の虫取りにも少し慣れてきました。
メモ）カブトムシの雄には立派な角がある

８月１０日
せっかくの夏休みだから、とみんなを遊びに誘ったら断られてしまいました。男の人にはたくさん優しくしようと思ったのに……

８月２４日
虫を捕まえて戦わせるのにも飽きてきました。
夏休みって、男の人といっぱい遊んで素敵な思い出を作るものではなかったの？私が間違っているの？教えて王子様。

８月５５６９日
あたらしいおとこのひとがほしい。あたらしい〇〇を××えてていねいに△△あげてわたしの〇△△で△×〇て■■■■■■■■■（ギシンとアンキにより検閲済）

You work to support your family. It's just the right thing to do.

You work to provide the best life you can. It's just the right thing to do.

You work so you can all keep living. It's just the right thing to do.

As long as you're doing it willingly, that's where true freedom lies.

As long as you're doing it willingly, such toil is a thing of beauty.

As long as you're doing it willingly, such work is enjoyable and fulfilling.

...Those are the kinds of lies you've been telling yourself, aren't they? Isn't it about time you stopped lying to yourself?\n\nDon't you want to live without having to work from dawn to dusk? To spend the day relaxing? To have someone else make food for you? To take a bath when you feel like it and go to sleep at whatever hour you like?

Even if you manage to strike it rich through working, well...\n\nYou can't, as they say, take it with you. Sure, you can leave it to your family, but you? Well, I hope you enjoyed it while you were alive. Oh, you didn't? You were too busy working? Isn't it all so pointless? Just stop. The only winning move is not to play. That's the truth of the world. Life's too short not to spend every moment you can taking it easy.

There's a story around here about a wolf who took the life of an old woman already on her deathbed. Why did he do it? It was to avenge his family. This story is about that revenge.

"Wolf hides sell for a fortune!" the old woman's husband said, as he proceeded to slaughter the animal's family. At the opportune moment, the wolf bit the old man to death and vowed to murder the rest of his relatives.

Next was the old lady. After learning of her daughter and grandchildren, he skinned his victim, covered her up, and waited patiently. When the lady's granddaughter, a little girl, showed up, he swallowed her whole.

But it was an act the wolf would soon regret. The girl violently devoured the wolf's belly from within, and thus the beast could never carry out his revenge. The author too would never finish the tale, and so it ended peacefully.
ぼくはこのこのものがたりをよんで、まずさいしょにかわいそうだなっておもいました。それは、うまれたときからわるいまじょにしんでしまうのろいをかけられてしまったからです。
ほかのまじょたちはそののろいをふせぐことをできないし、しぬかわりに１００ねんもねむりつづけるまほうをかけられるなんて、ぼくにはちょっとたえられないなっておもいました。
だって１００ねんもねていたら、おいしいものをたべることも、おそとでじゆうにあそぶことも、すきなひとといっしょにいることもできないからです。
でもそんなのろいがとけるころにおうじさまがあらわれて、そのきすでめざめてはっぴーえんどだなんて、やっぱりにんげんのつくるはなしは、ごつごうしゅぎなんだなとおもいました。

Question. Before you is a feeble kitten and a thirsty man. You are holding a glass with little to no water inside it. Who would you offer it to? However, the man is wealthy and would be willing to pay you back for your kindness.
Hm, an interesting answer. Now for my next question. You must poison one of your parents. Which would you choose? Both of them work and have equal incomes, but your mother does most of the housework.

Fabulous! All of your answers are honest and true to your greed! Let's continue. If you could live a life of extravagance and glamor for the rest of your life and never have to worry about food, clothing, shelter, or anything else... Would you take it?
You would? Excellent! What honesty and loyalty to your desires! A truly desirable soul! I shall grant you that wonderous life! Suffer no more, for there is no sorrow in the afterlife.

Once upon a time, ten bickering brothers lived together in a cottage. None of the brothers could ever seem to understand his siblings, and they quarrelled and scuffled daily over the most trivial of things. Indeed, it seemed as if they truly might contrive to disagree over the color of the sky.

As time passed, their scuffles grew fiercer, until the anger they felt spilled over into genuine violence. Once day, a girl they'd never met appeared at their cottage and offered to do a ceremony to help them get along.

The eldest brothers agreed that such a thing could only be for the better, and beckoned their younger siblings, and the girl bade them all gather together into a room, with her at the center. Then, in one fluid motion, she shrugged her huge maul off her back and smashed in all their heads.

"Now you'll never quarrel again!" she chirped, pleasantly, pounding their lifeless flesh a few more times for good measure. She shrugged on her red riding cloak, stained fresh scarlet with the blood of ten men, and left in search of her next victims.

「そこの方、私の実験体になってもらえませんか！？」
「お主、初対面の相手に向かってその言動はどういう了見だ！親の躾は一体どうなっておるのだ！？」
「親、というと私の作者のことでしょうか。いやぁすみません、どうしてもこの探究心を抑えきれず……！！私、作者も実験したいんです！脳をホルマリン漬けにして、それから……」
「無礼な物言いだけでなく、実の親を実験体にするとは何事か！それが貴様の忠義、言うなれば親へ返すべき恩であると申すか！そこに直れ、その首を刎ねてくれよう！」

「はい！探求心を解消するには実験あるのみ、それが親の躾です！私は親をも実験することで、親の恩に報いています！」
「ううむ……、それは一体どういう躾なのだ……」

姉妹：しんでれらノ美貌ニ嫉妬シタ醜イ女ソノ二ト三。

魔女：モット根本的ナ原因解決ニ魔法ヲ使ウベキ。
魔法：時間制限有リノ不完全ナ代物。魔法ト呼ベルノカ謎。

舞踏会：出会イノ場。現世ノ婚活ぱーてぃナルモノト酷似。
がらすノ靴：硬質ナ靴ハ脚ヘノ負担ガ多大デアルト予想。
結論：魔女ハ魔法ヲ使ッテオキナガラ、何故がらすノ靴ダケ本物ヲ用意シタノカ。ソノ一点ノミガヒタスラニ気ニナッテ、物語ノ結末ナドハモハヤ些事ニ過ギナイ。
剛き神曰く「両親の身勝手な理由により無慈悲にも森の奥に捨てられるも、知恵を振り絞りて、再び親の元へ帰らんとす。かの兄妹の姿、いと哀れなり。
然るに、菓子の家に住う妖異な老婆に囚われ、死の危機に瀕する。されど、その巧みな頭脳で窮地を脱し、無事生還すること感服する他なし。
かくて、老婆の財宝を携え家にたどり着き、父親と幸せに暮らすなり。これぞ、民草の知る本来の兄妹の物語なり。されど、この者に限り、さにあらず。
何故か、この者のみ、物語の中から逸脱し、虚妄の中に一人生きるなり。誰ぞ奇異なるその顛末を知らんや。我ら神の身にすらも、その所以は知らず。その行末も知らず」
[Match Divination: Shinku]\nWhich Library characters are compatible with the calm, proud yet compassionate fifth doll Shinku?

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Alice]\nBoth have a deep affection for their author. However in Alice's case, she will take whatever means necessary for her author. A clash may occur due to a difference in opinions.

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Snow White]\nTime spent with the righteous Snow White should be rather pleasant. However, it would be best to avoid discussions of morality before it turns into conflict without resolution.
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Dorothy]\nDorothy's curiosity fuels her lack of ethics, making her the worst possible match. Keep away from her or she may find a way to use you.
[Match Divination: Suiginto]\nWhich Library characters are compatible with the brutal, cynical yet longing for love first doll Suiginto?
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Alice]\nYou both have a love-hate relationship with their author.\nAn open conversation may be the beginning of a promising friendship.

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Cinderella]\nDue to an equally cunning nature, this would be an unfortunate paring. Every conversation would turn into a battle of mockery and sarcasm. It would be best to stay away.

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Red Riding Hood]\nTerrible chemistry. Red Riding Hood is a cold-blooded murder, the very definition of "garbage." If you want to witness something truly broken, look no further.
[Match Divination: Suiseiseki]\nWhich Library characters are compatible with the shy, criticizing yet gentle third doll Suiseiseki?

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Princess Kaguya]\nNot a good match. A gentle person such as yourself would never come to terms with Princess Kaguya's desire to be abused by someone stronger than herself.
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Rapunzel]\nNot a good match. Your heart is too pure to understand Rapunzel's need for a man.

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Aladdin]\nAladdin's world revolves around money. You may pity him for his beliefs. Not even you could heal this man's heart in the dream world for it has since rotten away.
[Match Divination: Souseiseki]\nWhich Library characters are compatible with the loyal, diligent yet fragile fourth doll Souseiseki?
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Pinocchio]\nPinocchio, who relies on codependency, may be similar to yourself as you need your twin. However, you are am to stand by yourself.
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Hansel and Gretel]\nGretel's crazed desire for her brother may consume you. However, unlike Gretel trapped in her own delusion, you can wake up.
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Hamlet]\nKeeping a distance from this man is advised. If he becomes your master, you'll offer your very being for the "beauty" he seeks.
[Match Divination: Kanaria]\nWhich Library characters are compatible with the cheerful goof-up, yet collected second doll Kanaria?
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Nutcracker]\nThis old man will listen through one ear and out the other. Not worth the time or effort.\n"I gotta get outta here!"
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Three Little Pigs]\nDon't leave your lunch around these three. You might be out of one.\n"I hope they'll leave the fried egg at least!"
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Dorothy]\nTerrible chemistry. Dorothy may appear friendly at first glance, but her curiosity will disassemble you.\n"I won't let her near me!"
[Match Divination: Hinaichigo]\nWhich Library characters are compatible with the innocent and spoiled, yet brave sixth doll Hinaichigo?
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Sleeping Beauty]\nNot a good match. Sleeping Beauty treasures her sleep more than anything. However, she'd make a good playmate when awake.

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Little Mermaid]\nThis tragedy relishing mermaid will adore your tears. She will not be there to comfort you when you cry of loneliness, but rather watch your sorrow and beg for more.

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Red Riding Hood]\nThe difference between your "play" and Red Riding Hood's "play" is black and white. The very moment you agree to the proposition, you will be torn to shreds.

「熊さんだ」「熊の手って美味しいんだって」
「内臓は薬になるんだって！」「食べちゃおう！」
ある日森の中、俺はヤバイ子豚に出会ってしまった。

「食べて寝る。起きて食べる。俺の力が宿ったこの武器なら、
そんな生活を永久保証」「ゴクリ……」「でもそれって、
お高いんでしょ？」「タダです」「下さい！」「あざーっす」

「熊さん、変なの」「わたしたち、体が動かない」「武器を持っても、狩りをする気がおきないの」「別にいいんじゃね？
ゴロゴロしてれば空腹も忘れるよ」「……うん、そうだね」

「……おーい」俺の呼びかけに、子豚からの返事はない。
様子を見に行きたいが面倒だ。放っておこう。
何の気力もないなら、生きてても死んでても変わらないから。
不思議な力というのは素敵なものだ。魔法は灰かぶりの惨めな私を飾りたて、王子の心を射止めさせた。愚かな家族への復讐も叶えてくれた。何もかも力があってこそのものだ。

そうして今、私はさらなる力を手に入れた。
全てを従え、殲滅する力だ。
この圧倒的な力があれば――
作者なんて、もう要らないんじゃないか？

別に作者を愛している訳でも忠誠を誓っている訳でもない。
ただ蘇れば便利だなと思っただけ。今はこの力があるし？
登場人物に見捨てられる作者ってのも素敵でしょう。ねえ？

"Come, let us depart, you who hold the seeds of beauty." One by one the children follow the sound of the man's pipe. Their numbers would grow until not one child remained in the town.

Noticing the missing children, the adults anxiously searched high and low, but to no avail. Fathers called out the names of their children, mothers wailed. And in the shadows—a group of old men watched with a twisted grin.

"Good riddance. Now we've got more to eat."
"Those kids would have been the death of us if they stayed."
"They can always make more of 'em at the right opportunity."
The old men's lives had been spared, if only temporarily.

Outraged by the men's selfishness, a young couple took them away and drowned them. Word of this event eventually reached the far-off land to where the children had escaped. Raising their eyebrows they said, "How could they be so cruel?" and thanked the piper for stealing them away.

その悲劇的結末に、彼女は満足したかもしれないが、周囲の者たちもそうだとは限らない。
娘の命を奪われた人魚の王は、人間に化けられる薬を魔女から奪い、海上へ向かった。魔女が薬について何か伝えようとしていたのに気付かぬほどに、彼は憤慨していた。
地上に出て憎き仇の姿を見つけると、人魚の王は薬を飲む。人間の足になって歩き出すと、両足に激痛が走った。不審に思った人間の衛兵たちが彼を取り押さえた。
人魚の王は慌てて助けを求めるが、なぜか声が出ない。全ては薬の代償だった。人魚の王の復讐は失敗に終わり、彼の物語は誰にも知られる事なく、静かに幕を閉じたのだった。
ぼくはこのものがたりをよんで、さくしゃはすごくてきとうなひとだなっておもいました。なぜなら、いろいろとへんなところがあるからです。

スノウホワイトも、なんかいもあやしいものうりにだまされすぎです。ばかなんじゃないかなっておもいました。おうじもしたいでいいからもらいうけるとか、なんかこわいです。
りんごがくちからでてきていきかえるなんて、りんごがのどにつまってきぜつしてただけです。りんごのどくはきいてない。ばかしかでてこないばかなはなしだとおもいました。

The little mouse was full of hate, full of a determination for revenge. The flames of its vendetta burned, hotter and larger than it thought possible, although the mouse knew itself to be small, and powerless to act on its grudge.

It needed allies. Despite the hatred eating away at its insides, the mouse tried to think calmly. To repay its enemies, it needed overwhelming power. It needed confederates with that kind of power, who would work to achieve his ends even if their goals were not the same.

The objects of it revenge were many. They rabbit who had taken it home. The bird who had poisoned it, half in jest. The crocodile who had killed its saviour. The frog who had ruined its winter stores. The deer who had trampled and killed its fellows. Finally...the tiger who had eaten its child.

The mouse vowed to make them pay, each and every one of those who had made it feel bitter and helpless because of its size. It would make them pay for that humiliation with their lives, if it took all the rest of his short years.
