Story [The Tale of Rimuru Tempest]
Satoru Mikami was just your ordinary corporate worker.
One day while walking along the street, he was suddenly stabbed to death by a passerby.
When he awoke, he realized his soul had reincarnated into an alternate world as a slime. In this new world, he took on the name Rimuru.
In this world, Rimuru tried eating all sorts of things.\nHe paid close attention to the effects of each thing he ate and took advantage of its strengths.

During his journey, he became friends with various demons.\nFighting alongside each other, they learned the value of friendship regardless of their race. He became popular with everyone and seemed to have friends everywhere he went.
Rimuru and his demon friends aimed to form a country where humans and demons alike could live together as equals.\nAcross the land word spread of their endeavors and soon the rest was history.
Story [The Tale of Shizue Izawa]\nOnce upon a time, there was a girl who was burned to death from an air raid. However, her body was summoned to an alternate world and was given the name Shizu.

Although Shizu's life was saved, her body eventually succumbed to a fire spirit. This led to a tragic incident where she killed a dear friend. It is later when she encounters a hero that she learns to find peace with herself.

If it weren't for the fire spirit, Shizu wouldn't have lived for as long as she did. She spent her many years training until she became strong enough to be called a hero. After that, she taught children she met on her travels how to fight.
But this long journey of hers would sadly come to an end soon after her encounter with the slime Rimuru.\nBut her soul can now rest in peace. Surly those she taught on her travels wish the same.
Story [The Tale of Shuna]\nLong ago there was a clan of demons known as ogres.\nThe ogres had a young princess whose brother was in line to lead the clan. She loved her brother dearly.

But one day the ogre clan was assaulted by a powerful demon. Including the princess and her brother, only six of them managed to escape the onslaught.\nIn the end, their people and homeland were lost.

Unable to bear reality, the princess ran away. It was then that she met a slime named Rimuru.\nDue to a misunderstanding, Rimuru gets mixed up in a fight with the ogres. Rimuru forgives them by giving them each a name as proof of their friendship. And from that day, the princess took on the name Shuna.

Rimuru assisted in the ogres long-awaited revenge.\nAnd even after justice was served, they chose to stay together. Shuna had lost everything dear to her, but thanks to Rimuru's new country she had a new place to call home. And the rest is history.
Story [The Tale of Milim Nava]\nThere once was a beautiful girl named Milim.\nDespite her appearance, she was incredibly strong and had lived many years.

Milim was the demon king, the strongest demon of them all. She could easily create a catastrophe with a snap of her fingers. Not one being stood a chance. And the boredom was more than she could take.
One day, Milim encounters a slime named Rimuru.\nShe was intrigued by the amount of knowledge the slime held.\nAfter years of boredom, she felt enjoyment in his presence.

Thanks to her good friend Rimuru and the country he created, her old life is now just a memory.\n Together with her newfound friends, her days are now filled with joy and laughter. And the rest is history.
Story [The Tale of Alice the Ogre]\nOne afternoon, a demon girl found a strange rabbit dashing through the grass.\nIt was holding a watch, panicking, saying, "I'm gonna be late!"

The demon chased the rabbit, but suddenly fell into a deep, dark hole.\nThe path twisted and turned, and when she landed, it was head first. Splurt!\nRight below her was the rabbit, pierced by her horn.

Tossing away the dead rabbit, the demon went on an adventure through Wonderland.\nThere she met a Caterpillar, a Cheshire Cat, a Hatter, and a March Hare.\nBut she found their attitudes to be quite annoying and used her powers to silence them all.

Dead bodies were scattered across Wonderland.
The Queen of Hearts cried out, turning pale.
"Off with this demon's—!"
But before she could finish, the demon girl had chopped of the Queen's head instead.

Month: △ Day: 〇\nAfter hearing rumors of mysterious and bizarre noises, I visited a ranch to inspect the situation. I thought I'd find some kind of creature or unidentified animal, but all it was were three little piggies with grumbling tummies.

Month: △ Day: □\nThey just eat, and eat, and eat! It's like their stomach is black hole, for how much they stuff down their throats! Their insatiable desire must have developed by science. Come to think of it, Princess Kaguya once said, "When my body isn't satisfied, I just take care of it myself."

Month: △ Day: ×\nFirst to put the very best ingredients in a pot to simmer. Sulfuric acid will then dissolve the hard metals and make them easier to chew. Oh, and I can't forget to add the secret compound. Who needs love when you have science!

Month: △ Day: ◆\nAt last, my edible outfit is complete! The pigs seem to be pleased with it. They haven't stopped chewing on it since! That does cause for some concern since it does connect with their physical bodies... Well, being self-sufficient is the first step of adulthood, so they say.
Story [Snow White the Slime]\nOnce upon a time, there was a beautiful stepmother with a heart of coal and a slime-girl with the heart of an angel.
One day the stepmother requested a hunter to kill the slime, but the hunter's bullets flew right through the slime's gooey body.

The stepmother's next attempt was to disguise herself as an old woman and offer the slime a poisoned apple.\nThe slime ate the poisoned apple, but since the poison was meant to kill humans it had no effect on her.
The slime covered the stepmother with its viscous body and absorbed her whole.\nThe next person she absorbed was the prince.\nAnd the rest is history.
To my dearest. I'm devastated to hear the exiled colony is so cold. There is still a power struggle going on at the royal palace. Their lust for control has them dragging each other down.

To my dearest. Many a night I've shed tears for you. The only one who offers to listen to my grieving heart and offer condolence is the chief concubine. Oh, how I wish the was some way to bring you back to the Capital so we can be with each other again.
To my dearest. I write to you with wonderful news! The chief concubine came up with a secret plan to bring you back! I will relieve you of your crime and save you from exile!

The plan involves scorpion venom. I'll use it to coax the king and have him grant my wish! No matter who's hands my body falls into, my heart will be with you always. So please... Pray for me that I may not be poisoned.

This is the story of the Bear who Lived and Idle Life.\n\nOnce there was a bear who lived on a mountain, and grew up in the shadow of a cold and violent Papa Bear. Mama Bear pretended not to see what was happening to her child, until the day that Papa Bear died right in front of their eyes.

The bear, having seen such terrible things in the course of her short life, became terrified of the outside world. Knowing only the violence that had been inflicted upon her, she turned it now against Mama Bear, and stayed in the house, refusing to work and lazing away each passing day. Mama Bear worked to support her, and to take care of her and the house, until one day she collapsed from exhaustion.

The bear felt regret as she looked upon her fallen mother, and little by little, began to work to revive herself. She left behind her slovenly ways until at last she even tried to set foot outside, only to be struck dead, immediately.

Oh, she never should have tried to go outside. The bear felt this regret so powerfully her spirit lingered on as a ghost. This would have been a rather sad ending to the tale, had the bear not stumbled upon some girls to possess.\n\nThe bear lived happily ever after, insomuch as ghosts can be said to live. The end.
The young girl spoke to a shadowy, bird-like spirit. "All I want to do is sleep, so please don't get in my way." However, what the spirit said next, the girl could not recall.

Wreathed in thorns, she softly drifted off into the sea of dreams... Until the spirit's voice rang out, awakening her from her almost restful slumber. "Ugh, go away! Can't you see I'm trying to sleep?"

Make no mistake, dear reader, the girl bore no ill will towards the witch that had cursed her. In fact, she was grateful. 'A curse that lets me sleep?' she thought. 'More like a blessing in disguise!'
You see, what she longed for above all else was peaceful, quiet slumber. And yet... And yet!\n\n"Argh! You stupid noisy bird. Just let me rest!" Saying this, she brandished her weapon...

The man appeared in town playing the beautiful melody of his pipe. Before the doubtful people, the piper declared, "I shall exterminate the filthy rats from your town and restore its beauty—based on my reward."

He was commissioned the job and as promised, wiped out the rats with the sound of his pipe. However, the town's people refused to pay him his sum, excusing themselves as needing to support the children in this hard life.
The piper shamed the people. "What a pity," he began. "How oblivious you are that you're forced to ignorantly deceive me. Very well, I'll deal with the source. Removing it is simple."

The town had become beautiful. No more were rats scattering filth through the streets, and gone was the source of the town's fund-consuming troubles. The piper laughed. He had gotten something good for his work: beautiful, innocent children.
Father? What's the name of the animal with the really nice big hair?

Um, well, it has four legs like a dog. And um...lots of sharp teeth? It looks like it would really really hurt if it bit you! Oh, and it's kinda like the lion we saw at the zoo before, but a little not like that, too. Do you know which animal I mean?

Why can't you tell, though? You always know so many things, Father...you can't see it? You really can't? It's right there! No! It IS right there! I'm not lying! Please, you have to listen, Father! What is it called?
Because, it says if we can't guess its name, it's going to eat us both up!
"Look, Weiss! There's a mountain of books here!"\n"Don't get carried away, Emil! Don't touch other's belongings without permission!"
"Weiss! What do you think this one's about?!"\n"'Behind the Bizarre Killings'...Don't open that!"
"Murdering your entire family, all on some notion it'll grant you power?"\n"Idiocrasy. I rather not think of what fools would allow themselves to be consumed by such thirst."
"Would that make me a fool, too, Weiss?"\n"My boy, you... You protected. Someone who protects out of love is no fool."
I don't get it. Why do living things die? Where do you think they go? Where is Heaven? Is it really true that we become stars?
I don't get it. Why are babies born? How do they get inside Mama's tummy? Is it really true that birds deliver babies in a sack?
I don't get it. Why won't you tell me? I wanna know the truth! ...Fine, I'll just get the answers myself!
Babies? I figured it out myself. I also found out why animals die after trying it. Learning is so much fun!

He's awake.
Now we're to monitor him for the rest of his life.
That is our duty for us sisters. We were created for the sole purpose of completing the project.
He had a gentle nature.\nEach day he would slave away at work for his little sister's sake.\nWe tried to support him as much as we could.
He became lonely.\nAfter his sister was unjustly taken away from him, his mind has become desolate.\nWhat we should be focusing on is the project. Not feeling pity for him.
He pointed his sword at us.\nOnly by killing him with our own hands can we complete the project.\nOur feelings mustn't get in the way. It's for the sake of the project...

He's awake.
Now we're to monitor him for the rest of his life.
That is our duty for us sisters. We were created for the sole purpose of completing the project.
He had a gentle nature.\nEach day he would slave away at work for his little sister's sake.\nWe tried to support him as much as we could.
He became lonely.\nAfter his sister was unjustly taken away from him, his mind has become desolate.\nWhat we should be focusing on is the project. Not feeling pity for him.
He pointed his sword at us.\nOnly by killing him with our own hands can we complete the project.\nOur feelings mustn't get in the way. It's for the sake of the project...
The wolf, driven by anger snarled. That girl is uncontrollable. She doesn't even recognize what she's doing, warranting murder in the name of justice.
Moody little girl, get the hell out of bed. All you do is lounge around and sleep all the time. Admit it, you're just running away from reality, aren't you? You're no different than a corpse.
What is all that fuss, Big Brother? They're so noisy.\nIt was how they escaped reality, freely becoming lost in their own thoughts and delusions. What was that called again? Oh yeah, XX#$W&.
No matter who I see or where I turn, it's the same old crap. Am I crazy for being annoyed by people of this caliber? Argh, I'm irritated at myself for not being angrier!
"Power is yours! Don't you forget your anger and hatred, Kainé!"\nAs I laid dying, I was brought to life by an abominable creature.\nPossessing my insides, it sought me to kill.
"Kainé! It's an enemy! Kill it! Kill it now and bathe in its blood!"\nKilling is its pleasure. That's all it cares about.\nAnd before I realized it, I found pleasure in killing, too.
"Stay alert, Kainé! Something big is coming!"\nThe ferocity inside me blared like a siren.\nThough I mostly found it annoying, its voice was reassuring in the midst of battle.

"Hey, Kainé! We've got even more slaying tomorrow! Gahahaha!!!"\nHis words had found my bruised and blackened heart, forming the twisted bond we have now.\nAnd became my staple for life—the strength to keep me living for tomorrow.
Veiled by darkness inside a shipwreck was a girl distraught by her "monstrous" self. One day a man wandered into the ship and offered her kind words. For her, these words were like a ray of hope.
She tried to fix her "appalling" voice, all so the man wouldn't come to hate her. But when she practiced the songs he taught her, her words were horribly mangled.

She tried to fix her "hideous" appearance, all so she could be with the man. She believed that eating people would bring her closer towards becoming a real human. And so... She gobbled up all who approached the shipwreck. However, her right hand remained black.

The outside world shined bright in the sunlight. The girl, having exposed her "monstrosity" to this world, was rejected by the man. All hope she had was lost. Scorched by the sun's rays, she disappeared—her being as fragile as a bubble.

"It's hard to breathe with this. Can I take this mask off?"
"It's got a funny face. But if you look closely, it's kinda cute."
"Yeah, yeah. It's that creepy kind of cute. I get it."
"I wish I had baggy clothes."

"Are those clothes? It looks like underwear."
"I don't like my skin showing too much."
"Awe, there's nothin' wrong with a little sexy."
"I like your flower hairpiece."

"Hehe, am I cool looking?"
"Yeah, totally! You look like a real protagonist!"
"I'll slice through anything with this huge sword!"
"Look! It's a sheep! Cut down the sheep! Then we can eat its meat!"

"It's a beautiful world, but somehow it makes me want to cry."
"...Are you crying?"
"I think so... Why do you think that is?"
"Because you're stomach's grumbling! Let's eat sheep!"
Around 3:00 PM on the day of %&, a caller reported of a man collapsed in front of the △□ Brokerage Firm. Shortly after, the man was transported to the hospital unconscious and in critical condition.

The man is said to be a day trader who lives in the vicinity of where he was found. Since no cash or credit cards were found to be left in his wallet, police are investigating the possibility of assault.
According to police, the man was being sued on suspicion of engaging in manipulation tactics on the stock market. They also reported that he had received a number of death threats online.

Update: The day trader has been just confirmed dead. The cause is said to be from a cerebral contusion hematoma due to a blow to the head. According to those familiar with him, the man had been complaining of poor health and...

Good Morning Daily [Tragedy Strikes Otaku Princess]\nA few days earlier, a female university student was pronounced dead at a gruesome scene in Tokyo. The girl was known for her polite and kind nature throughout the student body. Many mourned at her untimely death.

However, the student kept a surprising secret. At first glance, she seemed like your usual innocent and beautiful young lady. But according to those close to her, she was known as the 'Club Crusher' who slept with all the men in her club.

"She didn't care who the guy was or what he looked like. She said weird things like, 'All men are my princes.' The only reason guys joined the anime club in the first place was because they heard they could easily get laid. None of the girls liked her." Said one of her acquaintances.

As a result of indulging in her carnal desires in the name of love, she was resented by one of her many sexual partners. This resentment lead to him stabbing her to death in the middle of the day. Indeed, love gone too far is a frightful thing.

I want you all to remember this. I want you to carve it into your heart of hearts, that these are no naive blathering, not words to be brushed off as not worthy of your trust. And even as my voice trembles as much as my heart in this moment, I want you to know that even that is proof positive of the truth of these words. I want you to weigh them, and to find forgiveness.

The reason I left the city with Chris that night, the reason for all of my current regrets, is because I'd heard of the shadows, leaping like vaulting steeds and carrying the revelation of the heavens, and in my curiosity, in my blind foolishness, I had to see for myself.

And I looked upon the face of the Divine, and was looked upon in turn, and that is the plain honest truth. And the shadow, now like a lion, a being that I felt surely shouldn't exist appeared right before Chris and I and we were struck by revelation! We were truly Chosen!!

And at the same time as we proclaimed to all of you, you fools who know not the glory of the divine, we still offer to guide you towards forgiveness! So, let your minds wrap themselves in tranquilly as we ready you for sacrifice, as this is the Festival of the Divine!

On one dreary night, a raven caught sight of a women who had ■■ed her friend and stolen her ring. 'That greedy, wench!' it thought and loathed the woman. However...the ring that had ruined its owner seemed an alluring prize...

It would not be the last time the woman committed ■■■ to steal jewels. So the raven snuck into the woman's home and swiped all the jewelry she had poached. Uneasy, the raven's friends stated this too was ■■■■.
Adorning themselves with the woman's jewelry, the raven thought, 'Jewels dripping with ■ are beautiful. This enchanting beauty drives all to conflict and ruin.'

The raven put the ring in its mouth and slipped into a broken ventilator. The fan spun up suddenly, ■■■■ the raven's body and drenching the ring in its blood. To the raven, there was no greater beauty. As it died, the raven's last thought was frustration.
[Candy Apple Stall]\nBeing handed something so big all of a sudden is bothersome indeed.\nDo candy apples really have a whole apple inside?
[Festival Mask Stall]\nI already have one, so even if you say I can pick any one I like, it's a bother.\nHow should I wear the second one...?
[Corn on the Cob Stall]\nI keep telling you I don't want you to hand me food all of a sudden... It's bothersome.\nI think you should just give it to the people standing in line.
[Target Shooting Stall]\nI'm telling you I don't need any favors from you so...\nWait. Is that rabbit keychain a prize...? Then that's a whole other story. Let me show you what I can really do.
It's like a dream to enjoy a festival with you, dear brother.\nWasn't the cotton candy so delicious?\nWhy don't we take a look at some more food stalls?
Since it's such a hot day today, how about some shaved ice?\nIt comes with all-you-can-eat syrup!\nThere are so many flavors to try, I can hardly decide!
Strawberries and lemon, melon and green apples, or Blue Hawaii...\nSince we've got the chance, shall we try them all?\n...Ah, I'm sorry. I think I used too much!
The ice melted, and now all we have is just juice.\nHee hee! And you were just getting thirsty? That's so nice of you, dear brother.\nAnd that's what I love about you, too. Let's drink it together!
I've finished playing around with Nightmare in the freak show,\nso I'd like to go back and play games at stalls! I played all sorts of things a while ago,\nbut I want to try yo-yo fishing again!

[1st Retry]
I couldn't even fish one by myself, so the guy at the stall
just gave me a yo-yo as a consolation prize.
But I want to fish one myself!
[7th Retry]\nAw, I was so close that time! Don't you think? I think I finally got the hang of it though! Next time I'll definitely fish out a yo-yo!

[15th Retry]
It wasn't working out so well, so I tortured the stall guy a little.
Then he tried giving me a yo-yo, but I'm not accepting any more!
This is the final try, and I'm betting his life on it... I can't wait!
——Before the challenge: Katanuki Diecutting Stall\nAh... I see. So it's a game where you use a toothpick to cut out\na shape outlined on a candy? Then let's make something beautiful.
——1st Candy: 15 minutes later\nHm... This is more difficult than I had imagined.\nNo matter how careful I am, the narrow neck part always seems to break.
——5th Candy: 1 hour later\nI can't give up now. I have no intention of leaving here\nuntil I can make a clean and beautiful cut!

——30th Candy: 5 hours later
Ah, I finally made something that I'm satisfied with!
Truly beautiful! Now then, I must hurry and have my body consume it entirely!
...But how exactly?
That weapon being me, her trusty companion. As a hideous poisonous snake, I was abused, hated, and shunned by all. "But I love your ugliness," she said—and I loved her in return.
For her sake, I would do anything. She was in love with a prince, and had countless rivals. When I turned them all into corpses, her smile was nothing short of perfection.
Then one day, it hit me. Each rival I killed brought her one step closer to directing that smile at the prince, not me. My heart ached with regret and hatred. Her smile was mine and mine alone.
"You're hideous! Repulsive!" After I'd killed the prince, her curses ripped me to shreds. I'd fallen prey to my own poisonous jealousy. She was right... I truly am ugly, in both body and soul.
Me, Sleeping Beauty, and Princess Kaguya flew up into space riding the Sinoshuttle-1 that Dorothy built. I can't wait to play with all the bunnies on the moon! We can have a picnic!

Today I'm trying space food for the very first time. There's all these different packages with Dorothy's seal on them, like steak, curry, soup, even apples! But it all tastes terrible! (In other words, space food isn't bad, but the stuff with Dorothy's seal is.) (We didn't have time to get that far in development!)

It's super important to maintain your strength and muscles while in outer space, so I exercise on the ship. I would go for a walk or ride my bicycle, but...it's just no fun all by myself. I wanna play with Princess Kaguya or Sleeping Beauty. What'dya mean no weapons allowed? Does that mean I can use my hands? ...Not that either?

I found my first friend out here in space! They were out there just floating around, so I put on my spacesuit and went to go play with them! I think they was happy to see me, too 'cause we played a whole lot, and when I hit them on the head they shouted, "One day I'll destroy you humans!" It was so exciting!
*Yawn*...Am I dreaming? I can see the earth outside my window... It kinda looks like a round, blue candy. Ah. This isn't a dream. I really am in outer space!
Sleeping in zero-gravity is nice. I don't even have to worry about floating into a wall because my thorns will protect me. Now I can get a good night's sle—zzz...

Ever since we took off, Red Riding Hood has been nagging me to play with her. I'd rather take a nap... But knowing her, we'll find ourselves in a lot more trouble if she doesn't have something to kill her boredom. Fine. But I'm not doing this because it's fun!

I'm sleeping in a cradle they call a shuttle that goes through space. Sometimes I'll wake up, eat, play with Red Riding Hood, get my hair combed by Princess Kaguya, and watch the two act like weirdoes throughout the day. It's peaceful here. Like a dream, but it's not. I was hoping it would stay like this...forever.

We're just about ready for take off on our mission to the moon riding Sinoshuttle-1, the spaceship Dorothy built for us. When I returned to the moon in my own fairytale, I had forgotten all my memories of life on earth. But now we live in an age of convenience.

Day 1 in space. There's not a single bathroom installed on this ship. I did find an alternative way to relieve myself, but then all I wanted was to take a nice, refreshing bath. And even THAT was dreadful. Dry shampoo and a wet towel? It's incommodious...

Day 2 in space. Sigh... How my body longs for someone worthy to fight. But I must fight these urges. I'm in space. Not to mention I have two children on board with me. As the only adult here, I have to contain myself.

Day 3 in space. I'm desperately trying to suppress my fantasies of self-torment as I babysit the two...but I worry that perhaps they overheard me. Sleeping Beauty has been staring at me coldly. But even that is...delightful!

When I awoke in the Library, I was in darkness. The scent of blood was thick in the air, and something slithered, unseen. Even so, I felt no fear. Somewhere beyond that darkness, I knew I  would find them.
I would revive my Author. To accomplish that task, I've destroyed many souls. I've taken innocent lives. I've drenched myself in blood, now able to kill in order to survive. ...However.
Even once I revive them, I'm certain... I'm certain we'll never meet. With all the blood that stains my soul, I haven't the courage to stand before them. Then, you ask, why do I fight at all?

Once I revive my Author, I'll have no need to live any further. I'll be satisfied, as long as they're revived. Realizing this, feeling the truth of it, my heart is curiously light.\nWith that hope in my heart, I take up my sword once more and set forth.

When the tiger stepped into the palace, it found a heavily drunken nobleman. Apparently a women he had asked for her hand in marriage had cruelly rejected him. It was only when the tiger offered him some snacks and a drink as a means of consoling him, that their faces met.

The food recommended by the tiger glimmered in front of the nobleman like a mountain of jewels. He wet his lips in anticipation. As he nervously took a bite, the flavors melted in his mouth. Someone once said this dish was from the heavens, and that the tiger had to be a messenger.

The palace was soon abuzz about the tiger's cuisine. They gathered in crowds to feast upon its dishes, and the more they ate, the more they craved. Their hunger for it was enough to turn even the noblest of men into lowly beasts. The tiger watched on with delight.
Those whose souls have been corrupted smell as sweet and rotten as an overripe fruit. Once these men have all been consumed, the women they all desired will also be devoured.
Looks like another murder case is on our hands. Peh, those little girls won't be able to solve it. Therefore I, the great detective, is on the case!

The victim appears to me myself. Locked inside a room, I was hit from behind with a blunt object. However, no one laid eyes on the killer. Maybe those pesky characters took him out because they were all jealous of my brilliance.
The motive is obviously jealousy. And I suspect everyone but myself is involved. Now, all of you stand in a straight line! I'll reveal the name of the culprit of this murder mystery!

Heh...? You mean I fell and smashed my head on my own? I should have paid attention to my feet? Then it wasn't a murder case but an attempted murder? I've had enough of your blabbing! I deem you all as the culprit!

One day, a crowd of people barged into the cat's home hollering that the owner had killed a girl. The cat, refusing to believe their accusation, bit a man on the leg. But in spite of his resistance, they took the cat's owner away.

The cat was certain of his owner's innocence. That's because at the time of the young girl's death, he and the cat were at home ■■ as usual. His owner had no reason to kill the girl in the first place since neither of them were ■■■.

It was then that the cat heard of his owner's ■■ from one of their friends. But apparently it wasn't enough for the assailants. The cat felt faint at the image, but responded with a determination to act. His owner's ■■ had to be ■■■.

Although the incident had weathered away, the cat continued its investigation into the reasoning behind ■■, finally discovering that ■■ had ■■ed ■■. The pressure from ■■ must have been unbearable. However, the was no way for the cat to appeal it.
One day I smelled an odd odor coming from below the tower. Not long after, Mother stormed into my room, her face red in anger and asked, "Did you notice anything strange?" But nothing came to mind.
Mother had told me people were dying below us. So that smell could only be... Oh, how horrible! All those people had died at the hands of a swordsman. Did they come here to save me?
Surely it couldn't be the work of a forest beast. Perhaps they gotten into a fight with a bandit. I do recall hearing something of a struggle earlier... I must warn the prince!

Days later the prince arrived to my bedside. I told him of the horrible events that took place below the tower. He laughed and replied, "It's their fault they lost." Oh, dear prince, you seem different. Was your face always this way? It doesn't matter. A man is a prince in my eyes.
Tragedy has struck again... This time it occurred in a room on a luxury cruise ship hosting a party at sea. And since I happened to be present, I was named a suspect in the case...
The scene of the crime was in a VIP room. The victim was stabbed in the chest with a knife. Everyone is saying he was attacked in his sleep, which meant he had no time to defend himself...

Apparently the victim also had a fiancée. Still half asleep, the victim had mistaken his fiancée for the murderer? It's a pity... If only he had seen the truth, he wouldn't of had to suffer like this.

Evading everyone's eyes, I jumped off the deck and into the sea. My sisters welcomed me as I returned safely in my mermaid form. Farewell, my prince. I will live on your behalf. For this mermaid princess will never fade into seafoam.
Brother, I found a body torn to shreds inside the house. Was it the witch? No, she would have thrown them into her furnace.
It doesn't bother me who lives or dies. As long as my brother is in good spirits and we're together, I'm happy, too. But since this house is a pigsty, we should clean it up.

Why do you think they dismembered him? Because it's easier to clean? Or was it because they hated him? ...Me? If it were me...I want them to dream. If you're body's in pieces, then you just like a doll.
Brother, there's more. I've found three bodies now. Do you think there were three witches? Wait... Let me get a better look at their faces.... Oh! It's mommy and daddy! ...And—Ahaha! AHAHAHA!
All's fair in love and war.\nA hideousl snake once fell in love with a beautiful woman, but its feelings were never to be returned. Perhaps, this was a tragedy...

The snake's owner was a beautiful, arrogant woman. She despised any and all more beautiful with herself, and loved the unsightly most of all. She only ever kept the snake by her side to highlight her own beauty.

The snake knew none of this however, and loved her, slaying any who would make her unhappy. The more it killed the more she preened, praising it, until at last one day the snake killed the man she loved and tore his body apart without a shred of hesitation.

This was no tragedy, either. No, it was nothing of the sort, for love is a battlefield, after all, and whoever thought to find justice on a battlefield? The snake was a fool to think that simply because it loved, it would be loved in return.
[Before Sunrise]\nThe Phantomhive butler wakes early. He cleans the silent halls of the mansion, and begins meal preparations, before rousing his master from slumber with a fragrant cup of tea.

[Lunchtime Preparations]\nA butler's splendid presentation truly shines on days when guests are due. Amid the praise for his special dishes and top notch hospitality, he merely smiles softly, as if nothing could be as natural as this.

[Today's Tea Time]\nHe neatly applies the cream and its delicate sweetness to freshly baked scones. He neatly applies the cream and its delicate sweetness to freshly baked scones. This is a butler's calling: to support his master's peace of mind in all things.

[Late Night Bliss]\nMidnight has come and gone, and the hour is late in green. The tiny "paws" of a kitten soothe him now that his long day's work is at an end. Tomorrow, he'll once more stand by his young master's side, supporting him.

There's a story told from a distant past about a man and a woman who fell in love and exchanged their vows in front of their friends. They became husband and wife and lived their days full of bliss and happiness. Soon after, the woman became pregnant with a child.

The anticipation of a new family member had the pair taking great care for each other even more than before. Their friends watched them from afar with utter delight. Until one day, close to the baby's due date, a fire broke out in the couple's home. During this time, the husband had been at work.
Failing to escape, the woman was engulfed in the raging flames and disappeared. However, at the wake of the fire, a baby was found. The husband would protect his child with his life.

Some years later when the child's facial features had begun to take form, the father was astonished to see that his son's face resembled neither his nor his wife's, but that of one of his friends. Since that day, the man struggles to smolder out the flame of suspicion burning deep within his heart.

[Morning Tea]\nHe finds himself drawn from the depths of sleep by his butler's voice and the aroma of tea. Blinking in the rays of morning light that slant through the window, he picks up the newspaper, every inch the master of the Phantomhive household.

[Afternoon Negotiations]\nHis blue eye is every bit as sharp as one would expect of the guard dog that prowls in the Queen's footsteps. The youth, with his taste for chess, stymies even adult players as he moves his pieces with graceful hands. At times, he looks up and calls for his butler. It seems he desires more sweets.

[Afternoon Tea]\nGraced with the sudden or unexpected appearance of his guileless fiance, Elizabeth, he feels not a little bit put-upon by the way she unabashedly describes herself as "cute", but despite this, is ever the perfect English gentleman, treating a lady to a lovely afternoon tea.

[A Late-Night Invitation]\nThe hectic energy of his day slows to a gentle flow after the sun sinks. As a pleasant sleepiness rises up to meet him, he lets his eyes shut, under the watchful gaze of his butler. Nothing disturbs his slumber, until the sun once more rises in the morning.

[Daybreak]\nHe turns towards the door at the sound of customers. A fey smile on his face, he offers a pleasant greeting and a bit of conversation. Coffins aren't the only tools of his trade, it seems.

[Daylight]\nAs a bit of hospitality, Undertaker's prepared handmade bone-shaped cookies, served alongside beakers filled with a strange and fragrant tea. His manner is easy, even in the coffin-filled gloom.
[Twilight]\nUndertaker's many "clients" sleep peacefully in neat rows of coffins, made beautiful by his work. He says he enjoys a bit of autopsy as a hobby.

[Nightfall]\nAs night falls, he encourages his customers to head home before the streets are too empty. After all, a grim reaper may be prowling at night. Just as his door quietly clicks shut, the streets of the city begin to fill with mist.

[Birdsong in the Morning]\nThe young lady opens her closet, taking her time to decide between dresses. Fortunately, it seems the Midford household hasn't yet discovered her intentions to sneak off to the Phantomhive Manor.

[The Sun Smiles Down at Noon]\nArriving in the gardens of the manor, she sees a familiar face and smiles, running forwards. Dashing towards her beloved fiance, her heart knows him to be dearer than the most lovely flowers or the cutest doll.
[A Delightful Break for Sweets]\nThey enjoy a lovely afternoon tea, served by his butler. The dishes the Phantomhive butler prepares are always the most splendid, delicious treats.

[Whispering Goodnight under the Moon]\nThe sun tilts downwards on its path, and the time to return grows closer. She wants to be the same bright, cute girl for the one she loves tomorrow... and sets out for home with that wish in her heart.

[Red Sun Rises in the West]\nThe solitary "grim reaper" watches the shining line of the horizon. Gaze gone distant, he launches himself down to land on the earth. Dressed all in red, his long hair catches the morning breeze.

[Red Blossoms with Lunch]\nHe already knows what he'll be hunting today. And tomorrow. And the day after that. Now, though, now's not the time to color everything red. He gives himself over to that fate, waiting for that time to arrive.
[Red Hair in the Red Light of Sunset]\nStreetlights begin to glow as dusk comes to the English town. He looks down on it all from the heights, as a cold wind rushes past him from the side.

[Red Moon Rising] \n He scents his quarry, and his face, in an instant, is a triumphant grin. He stretches languidly, before spinning into delirious motion. The full moon casts his shadow red against the bricks as he races through the town.

[7:00 - What is a Butler?]\nIt's been a few morning since they infiltrated this strange mansion, disguised as butlers. Incidentally, it seems a 'butler' is a sort of servant that wealthy people keep on staff, reflects the White Butler as she goes about her business.

[12:00 - Lunch Preparations]\nThe Gold Butler, unable to watch the White Butler's fumbling attempts at cooking, manages to secure a top of the line chef from somewhere or other. The two of them make a pretty good team, actually.

[16:00 - Cleaning the Study]\nThe Baron orders the White Butler to clean the study. Its many shelves hold countless stories, packed in. Reaching up to take a single book...she pauses, returning to her work.

[23:00 - Before Bedtime]\nAfter seeing their master off to bed, the Butlers' day of work is nearly done. They hear an echo of those strange puppets' laughter, though its source is unclear...Perhaps therein lies this mansion's secret.

Parrah-Noya's Marvelous World Tour #5
"This time, we'll have Little Mermaid dance the Samba for us!"
"Wow. I've never seen a more depressing samba in my life!"
"We may have miscast..."
"Well, she did say she was good at dancing, so..."\n"She's only recently gotten used to walking...and, doesn't it hurt?"\n"Creators tend to be fickle creatures, don't they?"

"Nevermind that, when I hear 'Brazil,' I don't exactly start thinking 'Fish'..."\n"I feel like meat dishes are more popular there."\n"Well... no one's planning on eating Little Mermaid, so I'll allow it."
Little Mermaid: "Bossed around and forced into this cheerful outfit...Poor, poor me..."\n"Oh, it's not so bad is it?"\n"In a way, it's kind of a reward, even..."

"By Russia, we're thinking Matryoshka Dolls!"
"Exactly! We'll use this chance to make a Matryoshka of our own!"

"First, we need to carve the wood."
"Parrah. Did you make me fat?"
"And then, we need to paint on the details."
"Parrah! You forgot to draw me arms and legs!"

"Now that you mention it, I heard that if you breathe on the smallest doll it's supposed to grant a wish!"\n"If that happens, we'll stop service immediately."\n"In that case, we just need to inject the power of evil, aaaaand...done!"

Gretel: "What the...a Matryoshka? No matter how many layers I open, the next one is always the same size..."\n"Heehee...the repetition, the despair that lasts until the early hours of the morning...it's quintessential SINoALICE!"
Drug Administration Day 1: I gave the male slave a trial dose of scorpion venom. He became so excited, he had a hard-on and was screaming for a woman. I was a good thing I had him chained.

Drug Administration Day 3: The man has gone crazy. The insistent creams and rattling of his chains have become unbearable. He even threw himself at me, an old man, to lend him my hole. So I stomped on his dick. Even his shrieks are annoying.

Drug Administration Day 5: The slave had collapsed foaming at the mouth. It appears he died of an overdose, but I was able to ascertain the efficacy of the drug. Since I had administered it on other slaves simultaneously, with consideration to their strength, they should be able to handle the next dose after two days or so.

I have completed my findings on the experiment. All that's left is to add usage directions and put it out on the market. I'm going to die of boredom if my wife, the Empress, and my concubine don't excite things up in this palace.

The snake looked up at the sound of a knock on the door. A pair of siblings—brother and sister—had arrived to the candy house, unaware of the danger they had walked into. The younger sister smiled innocently at her older brother who stood tense.

The house was a trap. If anything, the sweet smell of death gave it away. The witch who set the trap and the little girl who fell for it were none the wiser. For the women from the world the snake came from were much different.

To the snake, women were a vile, cunning creature. A hungry beast that seeks pleasure for themself. The snake was once killed by their greed, and knew if that same monster existed here, she would have laughed like a heinous bird.

The witch beckoned them inside and the little girl pulled her reluctant brother with her. Just before the door shut, the snake noticed a sorrowful pleasure in the girl's eyes. He took back his previous thought. No matter the world, all women were the same.
"The ideal maiden is always kind to men." Those words whispered repeatedly in my head. I vowed that if the prince wished it of me, I would be just that.

The kindness the prince showed me was much different from that of my mother. I thought how wonderful it would be if I could offer the same compassion to others, perhaps as a way to repay the prince for teaching me about the outside world.
And so, I repeatedly asked out, "Are there any men?" to which some women inquired "Why?" When I responded how I wished to show them kindness, they all looked at me coldly.
It must be strange to treat men with compassion in the outside world. Why else would the women be giving me strange looks? But that won't stop me. After all, it's a vow I made to all princes...
Before me lie the carcasses of wolves and sheep. My friends, loved ones...I've lost them all. There's nothing left for me. So what should I do with all this anger welling up inside of me?

Why am I angry in the first place? Is it because I couldn't stop my friends from vowing revenge on the sheep? Or because I didn't notice the sheep murdering my own kind? No... Maybe I'm mad at myself for allowing myself to fall in love with the sheep.

That's it, isn't it? If only I'd never gotten injured in the mountains and had my tail saved by those sheep. No, I shouldn't have attacked them and used them as bait. I never asked to be born as a wolf!
I'm so stupid. My entire existence is deplorable. The object of my anger is me!

When the big, bad wolf broke into the piglet's brick home, he was surprised to find a bear sleeping in bed instead of a detestable pig. Waking up with a yawn, the bear turned to the wolf and asked, "Who are you?"

"You shouldn't enter a girl's house without permission," the bear said. "No wonder no one trusts you wolves. You're savages." The wolf's eyes flared up in anger. "So which one of the hogs did you like best?"\n"I haven't eaten any yet!" exclaimed the wolf.

Instead of fearing the wolf as they should, the piglets instead buttered themselves up and chowed down on their own bodies. The wolf swore his revenge.\n"Sorry dear, but the piglets aren't part of this story anymore."

"But, now that I've heard your side of the story, you got me in the mood for some pork," the bear said licking its lips. A blood-chilling terror ran down the wolf's spine. Until he suddenly realized, he was the only one there.

Understand the terrible nature of gambling, and for a while at least, live a quiet life. Get dragged back into the student council's contests. Rise to the level of student council president, utterly embroiled in the constant struggle.

Little Red, Little Red. What'cha doing? Splish-splash, Splish-splash. A friend's come to play with you in the red pond.
Little Red, Little Red. You look so happy. Keeheehee. Your face is all red, even the cunning wolf is smiling.
Little Red, Little Red. Are you having fun? Your pounding heart sounds frustrated.
Little Red, Little Red. When your life becomes cold and frigid, its all over.

"I heard ye threw yerself into the overboard for the sake of yer lover. That's an admirable thing to do."\n"It was the only option I had..."\n"He must'a been some man. But why fall in love with someone when there ain't nothin' in it for ye?"

"You're right... My heart stopped when I heard he was getting married. It's funny... After all I sacrificed to become human, this is how it ends."\n"Well, I'm sure he knew how you felt."\n"I don't care about that."

"My love for him is so beautiful, nothing could ever replace it, and its memory will remain in people's hearts forever. To lose it all from his mistake... What a farce. Thank you for saving me in the nick of time."
"Are ye satisfied with this tragedy?"\n"Yes. Though it would have been better if his fiancée was a shrew."\n"Err... You didn't give yerself to love. Yer life's gone ta waste on yer ugly ego."

Parrah-Noya's Marvelous World Tour #8\n"This time we're in England, home of the gentleman!" "Isn't Pinocchio a bit too childish for this role?" "Meh, he's wearing the Royal Guard's uniform, so he's fine."

"These caps for the Royal Guard stand like towers." "They were originally designed that way as protection from the cold, but it's just to look taller and more intimidating to the enemy." "I didn't know that! But it makes sense. After all, the Pinocchio here does look a bit more brute compared to his usual cowardly self."
"If wearing a hat makes him stronger...we can call this the 'Pinocchio Power-cap Ext'!" "Woah! That's brilliant! Sounds like the perfect item for a new grimoire series!!!"

"We gotta propose this to management ASAP. We'll be rolling in dough without hardly lifting a finger!"\nPinocchio: "Wouldn't that be deceiving, though? Just because I look strong, doesn't change who I am on the inside..."
Parrah-Noya's Marvelous World Tour #7\n"Hola, amigos! Today we're with Sleeping Beauty in Mexico!" "Woohoo! ...Wait, why is she asleep?" "Well, that's kinda what she does."

"I hear this country's got a whole lotta music enthusiasts." "They even play it while on the job." "As they say, no music no life. So about that 'Day of the Dead' festival. Do they really hold a parade to celebrate the dead?"
"We get to play with the dead on a daily basis!" "Yep we do. We slice 'em, beat 'em, and pulverize 'em with glee." "Hey! Why don't we invite all of Mexico to the Library next time?"
"That's a great idea! A cross-cultural exchange!" "So don't be snoozing away and welcome our guests, Sleeping Beauty."\nSleeping Beauty: "I don't wanna... You don't need anymore victims..."

Was this punishment for all the bad things I've done? I found myself in an unfamiliar place. Looking down, my hand gripped the shaft of a strange staff.　Atop it, a foul-mouthed figure with a long nose. Safe to say we were nothing alike.

I followed the staff's orders and killed all my enemies. But I never wanted to do it. It's too much work to kill. And I don't want to be responsible for taking someone's life. I need to revive my author and get instructions from them fast...

No one wants to admit it, but it's easier if someone else is holding the reins. I just can't take all the tears...all the screams of the battlefield... They condemn me! As if asking whether I'm fine with all this.

But the staff just laughs it off. "Just forget about it," it says. "Clear your mind if you don't want to suffer." It's right. So I shake away such thoughts and clutch the staff once more. I am but a puppet. No matter if the strings maneuvering me are about to snap.

I had just been sent to the Library upon my return from the Land of Oz. In order to learn more about this place, I must first revive my author and get them to tell me what they know. When it comes to the truth, any sacrifice is a noble one!

Catch a nightmare and peek at what's inside. The Library is a treasure trove of research! So many mysterious happenings to pique my curiosity! Though I'd be able to gather even more samples if only my friends would help.
I tried looking up my friends, but ended up losing them forever. I really do love all this world has to offer. And I long to connect with others. Yet somehow, I am always alone.

...No! My friends remain at my side as samples! And as a bonus, once everything is sampled, I'll finally learn the truth and be connected to the world! Taking my weapon in hand, I dashed forward with a grin stretched across my face.
Parrah-Noya's Marvelous World Tour #1\n"We're all packed and ready to fly!" "World tour, here we come!" "You betcha!" "Our first feature is...the cheongsam!" "That's right! China, the home of ramen!"
"Pay attention. I told you, ramen is from Japan. The ingredients used aren't the same in China." "Oh yeah! I forgot there's that FUNKY sushi overseas, too!"
"I guess that means SINoALICE Global isn't going to be the same either, huh?" "Maybe yes, maybe no."
"Maybe we'll witness Alice donning a curly mustache with an assault rifle in hand! Wouldn't that be grand?!" "If you say so."\n\nAlice: "That would make me a different character."
Parrah-Noya's Marvelous World Tour #2\n"Round and round we go!" "Ain't no stoppin' us now!" "Woohoo!" "Next is a bedlah!" "A bed! You children better get to sleep now!"
"You're still on that? Did you even bother to look the outfit up?" "Wait, is that what those belly dancers wear?"
"Ding-ding-ding! Looks like we got a winner here."\n\n(It's not that hard to G**gle it!)
"But why would a Japanese princess need to belly dance? She could have gone for something more traditional and princess-like."\n\nPrincess Kaguya: "Traditional? What I want is torment and lust."
Parrah-Noya's Marvelous World Tour #4\n"Around the world we go! This time it's a hanfu!" "Yippee!" "Hooray!" "But this is our second time to China." "Did we already go full-circle?!"
"Who cares. I hear this outfit's popular with the youngsters." "There's people who rent clothes for photoshoots, too." "Think it's possible to rent the one Snow's wearing?"

"You need courage to pull off one of Snow's outfits! She's our Gran Election winner after all!" "She's a maiden at heart, albeit a bit complicating. Let's rent her out as a whole then!" "A 100% reproduction!"
"Talk about a fantastic service!" "Gotta get as many pictures in during our trip to preserve this memory."\n\nSnow White: "Ask before renting people out!!!"
Parrah-Noya's Marvelous World Tour #3\n"Next up is Huayno!" "Woohoo! ...Ueno? You mean the zoo in Tokyo? Is it a panda suit?" "No, it's not a panda! Huayno!" "Right! International!"
"I was looking forward to seeing a panda though." "Huayno have a close relationship with alpaca though!" "Those cute, fluffy things?! I smell profits! So where do we sign?"

"Alpacas are surprisingly aggressive though." "Cute, yet brutal. Sounds about right for Red here. Now if we can just sell them as a set..." "Plus the alpacas without white fur are on the endangered list."
"We can't! That little monster will guarantee their extinction if they meet!"\n\nRed Riding Hood: "No wait! I just wanna play with them!"

I woke up in a castle, surrounded in briars, but it wasn't my castle. I suppose I was grateful not to have been shaken awake by an annoying prince, but...well, nevermind, I suppose here's as good as anyplace, for a nap. I'm only going back to the world of dreams, after all.

...Or so I thought, but I've had to fight constantly ever since I got here!\nI've got to revive my author so I can finally catch up on sleep, but to do that I have to stay awake and fight. My strongest desires are in total conflict!

In the end, I decided to just ignore everything else and go back to sleep...but the moment I closed my eyes I got set upon by nightmares. Ugh! I'm never going to be able to do anything on my my own, and if that's how it is, then you all might as well sleep forever, too!
I really do have to revive my author. He'll write a much nicer world for me, with a much nicer curse. He'll make it so everyone is warm and comfortable, sleeping forever in a world of his creation.

I found myself lost, wandering into a world where my money meant nothing, and violence was rampant. Was I scared? Say rather that I was excited, thrilled with the possibilities of completely untouched markets! I mean, this was a once in a lifetime chance!

Would that things were so simple. I couldn't find a single person with the foresight to understand my vision! Faced with the endless fluctuation of the markets, I knew I'd have to innovate myself first, if I wanted to do anything else.

If she knew I was still thinking about money all the time even after wandering into another world, well, I can just see her roll her eyes. Maybe she wouldn't even be exasperated. Maybe she'd just get that sad look on her face, sigh an look away like she always did when she was blaming herself. I'm pretty sure I'm going to hell. Sooner than later, by the looks of things, too.

God, half the time I'd swear I'm there already! It'd almost be a relief, if I knew for sure! No problem! After all, I'm pretty sure they've got capitalism in hell. In the meantime, I'm gonna stay on the grind, and keep making money right up until the moment the world sees fit to end.

I wandered into this world, looking for the person I'm destined to meet.\nI can't remember my author, but I know they're responsible for the fall of that wonderful man, and for tearing me away from my parents. Such a one should surely be able to torment me to my heart's desire.

In order to revive my author, I must defeat my enemies. It fills me with such jealously. If only someone would run me through, if only they'd send me to such a pitiful end. Simply thinking of having such love makes my blood sing...
I wonder how my author loves? Would they cherish me like my erstwhile bethrothed? If so...I couldn't stand it, I would kill them in my sorrow. I could never be satisfied with such childish love.
I yearn to be twisted into shape, I, who was born so weak. Am I any closer to achieving that desire? I wish only to find the one who will take everything from me, and end my love right here...

She opened her eyes to impenetrable darkness, and knew fear. Even so, the drifts of pure white snow called her onward, showed the way. She had to revive her author. She owed it. If sacrifices were necessary to do so? So be it.

I cut down any who stood in my way, staining the road red. Even so, the darkness grew deeper, and the the snow fell thick until it was as if nothing had happened at all. Here in this world, closed in all around by the snow and the dark, I can be right. Just.

So I thought, I know that despite everything the dawn will break and the snow will thaw. It will all melt away and reveal the truth of my guilt. In that moment, the sunlight will consume me utterly, pyre's flames to a witch.

And yet. That time has not yet arrived. The sky is still dark, the snow falls in curtains, burying all traces of my passing. For now, I can move onwards. It matters not if the road ahead lies beyond my sight. In this moment, I can live for Justice, even if it's a justice all of my own.
Brother, do you remember?\nThe day we woke inside the library. You bade me fight, Brother, bade me revive our author. I was so happy. Finally, finally there was something I could do for you.

Brother, I'm sorry, but lately my injuries have been too much for me. Could you help me a little, Brother? Would you fight for me, too? I don't think I can fight all these witches by myself...No, that's not it at all. You only need to stay by my side.
Brother, I'm sorry, but more and more lately, my legs shake. My vision blurs. The bleeding won't stop. Brother, I think...I might be just a little bit tired.

Brother, dear Brother, I'm certain we'll drive the witches out of the Library soon. When we do, it'll be just you and me, alone in the world. A world for us, alone. Sweeter than any candy house, more wonderful than any dream...

The scent of blood made me bolt upright, and I found myself in an unfamiliar world. It was a world that seemed rife with wonderful possibility! I would be able to make so many new friends, and we would have so much fun as we fought to the death, together.

I kicked a ball along an orcish road, and dressed up in a wolf hide to play house. Everyone was happy to play with me and every day was so much fun! I've got my author to thank for creating me, so I could enjoy this.
One day, I'll kill my author, too, to properly show how thankful I am. He he, I'm such a good kid, right?\n\nBut...I don't really want to go home. There's no one left there to play with, not anymore.

Oh, that's right! Once I've killed everyone, I'll make my author write it all over from the beginning! I won't be mean about it, even if it's fake. It'd be too sad to lose friends. Then, this could be my playground, forever!

When I opened my eyes, I found myself alone in a world I didn't recognize. I was told if I wanted to see my author again, I would need to sacrifice countless lives to make it happen...The abject tragedy of it struck me, and I felt as if my heart might tear in two.

This world I've found myself in is a cruel place...I want to wash it clean with tears of sorrow, and revive my author. I suppose it's time then, to take my sword in hand, and to take the first steps on that journey. I'll show this world the depths of my sorrow...

Even so, no matter how fully a world overflows with sorrow, it can never drown you. Sorrow is personal. It belongs only to the individual who holds it in their heart, and the sorrow of others doesn't touch me at all. I don't understand, I'm the one who was meant to be the heroine of this tragedy.

I must revive my author as soon as I can, and return to the sea. This time, I'll run my love through, drag him down with me, and as the salt water carries away his crimson tears, I will become the tragic heroine I was destined to be. Won't I?
